According to the report , which measures indicators in areas including  the county 's economy , education , public safety , health , transportation and parks and recreation , the county has made significant strides .
The report , which relies largely on government sources and data , compares indicators in Prince George 's with other counties in the Washington region .

In 2012 , Prince George 's collected $ 481 million in sales taxes compared with $ 523 million collected in sales taxes that same year in Montgomery and $ 331 million in Baltimore City .
In April , County Executive Rushern Baker III  said in his State of the County speech to county business owners that the county has made significant progress since he took office in 2010 .
According to the Business Roundtable report , several indicators measuring the quality of education have improved .

The number of teachers designated   highly qualified ,  a term defined by the No Child Left Behind law , has increased since 2005 , with 89 percent of teachers in the county receiving that title in core subjects , including English , foreign language , mathematics , reading and language arts .

RelatedSentence: But the report notes that the county 's drop - out rate has risen from 3.57 in 2005 to 7.38 percent in 2012 .
